title: The Amazing Race: Meet Psychiatric Nurses Femi Ogunsiji and Nicholas Evbuomwan
text:
They're set to take on Channel Ten's The Amazing Race.

And long-time friends, Femi Ogunsiji and Nicholas 'Nick' Evbuomwan, from Sydney, are set to give fellow contestants a run for their money.

Femi and Nick will use their unique occupational skills of being Psychiatric Nurses to help aid them to win the newly rebooted reality show.

REVEALED! The Amazing Race: The advantage Psychiatric Nurses Femi Ogunsiji (left) and Nicholas Evbuomwan (right) have on the rest of the competition

According to 10 Daily, the pair have been friends since childhood, so getting on each other's nerves, while traveling from city to city, isn't going to be too much of a problem for the athletic duo.

The Sydneysiders also run their own personal training company, Access Fit.

And if Wednesday night's teaser trailer is anything to go by, the duo will make it through at least two different challenges - seen cheering after they complete a game of Sport stacking.

Game on! Sydney based Femi (left) and Nicholas (right) are full time Psychiatric Nurses, who run their own personal training company when they're not in scrubs

Grinners: If Wednesday night's teaser trailer is anything to go by, the duo will make it through at least two different challenges - seen cheering after they complete a game of Sport stacking

On Wednesday, we were introduced to sisters Therese Mills and Judy Bowe, from the Missionaries of God's Love Sisters.

In an interview with 10 Daily Judy revealed that their biggest advantage over the other teams - the power of prayer.

'I can pray for endurance, perseverance and courage when I don't have any left.'

'They might be a bit threatened by us!' Catholic nuns Therese Mills and Judy Bowe revealed their 'big' advantage over the other teams on The Amazing Race is the the power of prayer

In August, it emerged that North Melbourne rookie Tom Wilkinson had quit the AFL and signed up as a contestant on the program.

Tom, 23, will be joined on The Amazing Race Australia by fellow footy player Tyler Roos.

In The Amazing Race, the teams must take on various challenges across three continents in a bid to win a $250,000 cash prize.

The Amazing Race Australia is coming soon to Channel 10 and WIN
description: They're set to take on Channel Ten's The Amazing Race.
authors: Ali Daher For Daily Mail Australia
